Bronze and Xiaozhuan start from " bull " and " end ". The ancients believed that the shape of a rhino was like a buffalo, so " bull " was used as a sign, and the original meaning was rhino. There were a lot of rhinos in the ancient Yellow River, Yangtze River valleys and the south. The Han Dynasty mainly grew up in the south, so Xu Shen said that rhinos were outside the southern border. "Said Wen": "Rhinoceros (𤚌), a horn outside the south, with one horn on the nose and one horn on the top, like a hog. From the cow, it ends." Duan Yucai's note: "Er Ya, "Shan Hai Jing" Guo Note Liu Xinqi's "Tale of Jiaozhou" all said: "There are triangles, one on the top, one on the hawk, and one on the nose. The upper corner of the nose is short." "Liu Xinqi said: "Its hair is like a hog, its head is like a horse." Guo Puyun : "It looks like a buffalo, a pig's head." They are different." "Han Shu. "Ping Di Ji": "Huang Youguo presents a rhino", Yan Shigu's note: "Rhinoceros is shaped like a buffalo, its head resembles a pig and a quadruped elephant. Black, with one horn on the forehead and a small horn on the nose." Yan Shigu believes that rhino It is shaped like a buffalo, with a head like a pig and feet like an elephant.

Rhinoceros is a herbivore, shaped like a cow, with one or two sharp horns on its nose, short neck, thick limbs, thick hairless, blackish skin; its eyesight is very poor, and it can only rely on sensitive hearing and Olfactory life; grows in tropical forests in Asia and Africa. "Mozi. "Public Loss": "Jingyou Yunmeng, and the rhinoceros and elk are full." "Yunmeng" is a place name, also known as "Yunmengze." The whole sentence means that there is a cloud dream in the state of Chu, which is full of rhinos, si (beasts like bison), moose (commonly known as "four not like"), and deer. There is a record of " Rhinoceros " in the Qin slips of the Warring States period unearthed in Yunmeng County, Hubei Province, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "The Way of the Officials" Jan 17 3: "Rhinoceros Horn and Elephant Teeth" refers to rhino horn and ivory.

" Rhinoceros " later referred to rhino hide and rhino horn. Ancient books record that the armor made of rhino hide is very durable, "Zhou Li. Winter official test work record. Letter to People: "Rhinoceros armor has a hundred years of life", meaning that the armor made of rhino leather can last for a hundred years. The extension implies firmness and sharpness. "Yinqueshan Hanjian. The Art of War by Sun Bin. "Bing Qing": "Arrow, gold in the front, feathers in the back, so the rhinoceros is good at walking." It means that the front of the arrow is metal and the back is feathers, so it is strong and fast. In addition to describing weapons, "sharp" also describes the sharpness of language, rhetoric, and vision. Liu Yuxi of the Tang Dynasty, "The Collection of Governing Sigong Linghu from the Tang Dynasty": "The words are sharp and far-reaching." It means that the writing and eloquence are sharp and clear, far beyond ordinary people.

"Rhinoceros horn" is abbreviated as "rhinoceros horn" and is used in Chinese medicine. "Compendium of Materia Medica" by Li Shizhen: "Baopuzi" says: "Rhinoceros eats the poison of all herbs and the thorns of many trees, so it can detoxify."... "Beihulu" says: "Where poisoned arrows are used to prick sores with rhino horn In the middle, heal.” The rhino eats a hundred poisonous thorns.” The effect is that because the rhino eats herbs and thorns, the rhino horn can detoxify. If the poisoned arrow is inserted into the sore, the rhino horn will get better immediately.

The "horned rhinoceros" and "fus rhinoceros" refer to the uplift of the forehead near the hair. Ancient superstition believed that it was the appearance of noble and virtuous, and later referred to the wise. "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "Press "Jin Chinese": "The horned rhino is abundant." "Mencius" Note: "The horned rhinoceros jue land." "Warring States Policy": "The eyebrows are quasi-crested, and the rhinoceros horned moon." It all means that people are plump from the nose to the top, as the photo book says, "Fusion through the top"."

The allusion "Rhinoceros" and the idiom "Rhinoceros Zhao Niuzhu" came from the "Book of Jin. "Wen Qiao Biography" refers to Wen Qiao in the Jin Dynasty when he walked to Niuzhuji, Wuchang, and saw the unpredictable water depth, he burned rhino horns and saw strangely shaped aquatic creatures. Later, he used "Rhinoceros" as a metaphor for the faintness of the candles and observing the truth.

The inscription is used as the surname, Xi Bo Ding: "Xibai (Bo) fish father Zha (for) travel tripod." It means that Xi Bai (Bo) fish father made a tripping tripod. Chen Bingxin thinks that this " rhinoceros " should be pronounced " late ", I will say it. "Tong Chi. "Clan Strategy": "Chi family, Shang sages were late, looking out of Taiyuan. In the Eastern Jin Dynasty, there was Chi Chao, the prefect of Xiangdong."

Seal characters are used as names. "Ancient Seal Collection" 3927: "Gongsun Xi (鉨, Xi)", "Gongsun" is the last name, and " Rhino " is the first name. "Han Yin Character Sign": "Lu Xi's first seal", " Lu " is the surname, and "Xi Shou" is the first name. "Guang Yun. "Qi Yun": "Rhinoceros, last name. Qin has rhino head."

humanum_full_description:
金文、小篆從「牛」，「尾」聲，古人認為犀牛的形狀像水牛，所以從「牛」為意符，本義是犀牛。犀牛在古代黃河、長江流域及南方數量很多，漢代就主要生長在南方，故許慎說犀牛是南方邊境外的牛。《說文》：「犀（𤚌），南徼外牛，一角在鼻，一角在頂，似豕。从牛，尾聲。」段玉裁注：「《爾雅》、《山海經》郭注、劉欣期〈交州記〉皆云：『有三角，一在頂上，一在頟上，一在鼻上。鼻上角短小。』」「劉欣期云：『其毛如豕，頭如馬。』郭璞云：『形似水牛，豬頭。』說各不同也。」《漢書．平帝紀》：「黃友國獻犀牛」，顏師古注：「犀狀如水牛，頭似豬而四足類象。黑色，一角當額前，鼻上又有小角。」顏師古認為犀牛的形狀像水牛，頭似豬，足似大象。

　　犀牛是食草動物，形狀像牛，鼻子上長着一隻或兩隻鋒利的角，頸短，四肢粗大，皮膚厚實無毛，微黑色；它的視力很差，只能靠靈敏的聽覺和嗅覺生活；生長於亞洲和非洲的熱帶森林裏。《墨子．公輸》：「荊有雲夢，犀兕麋鹿滿之。」「雲夢」是地名，又稱「雲夢澤」。全句意謂楚國有雲夢一地，遍布犀牛、兕（像野牛的野獸）、麋（俗稱「四不像」）、鹿。在湖北省雲夢縣出土的戰國時期的秦簡中有關於「犀」的記載，《睡虎地秦簡．為吏之道》簡17三：「犀角象齒」，指犀牛角和象牙。

　　「犀」後來又表示犀牛皮、犀牛角，古書記載犀牛皮製造的鎧甲十分耐用，《周禮．冬官考工記．函人》：「犀甲壽百年」，意謂犀牛皮製的鎧甲可用一百年。引申有堅固、銳利之意。《銀雀山漢簡．孫臏兵法．兵情》：「矢，金在前，羽在後，故犀而善走。」意謂箭的前面是金屬，後面是羽毛，所以堅利而飛快。「犀利」除了形容武器外，還形容語言、文辭、眼光等的尖銳鋒利。唐劉禹錫〈唐故相國贈司空令狐公集記〉：「詞鋒犀利，絕人遠甚。」意謂文筆、口才尖銳明快，遠超常人。

　　「犀牛角」簡稱「犀角」，用做中藥。李時珍《本草綱目》：「《抱樸子》云：『犀食百草之毒，及眾木之棘，所以能解毒。』……《北戶錄》云：『凡中毒箭，以犀角刺瘡中，立愈。』由犀食百毒棘刺也。」大意是說因為犀牛吃百草、荊棘，故犀角能解毒，若中毒箭，把犀角插入瘡中，會立即好轉。

　　而「角犀」、「伏犀」指前額近頭髮處隆起，古代迷信認為是顯貴賢明之相，後來借指賢明者。《說文解字注》：「按〈晉語〉：『角犀豐盈。』《孟子》注：『頟角犀厥地。』《戰國策》：『眉目準頞權衡，犀角偃月。』此皆謂人自鼻至頂，豐滿如相書所云『伏犀貫頂』也。」

　　典故「犀照」、成語「犀照牛渚」出於《晉書．溫嶠傳》，指晉代溫嶠走到武昌牛渚磯，看見水深難測，於是燃燒犀角，照見奇形怪狀的水中生物。後以「犀照」比喻洞燭幽微，明察事理。

　　金文用作姓氏，犀伯鼎：「犀白（伯）魚父乍（作）旅鼎。」意謂犀伯魚父鑄造了隨行用的鼎。陳秉新認為此「犀」應讀作「遲」，姑備一說。《通志．氏族略》：「遲氏，商賢人遲任，望出太原。東晉有湘東太守遲超。」

　　璽印文字用作人名，《古璽彙編》3927：「公孫犀𡊑（鉨、璽）」，「公孫」是姓，「犀」是名。《漢印文字徵》：「呂犀首印」，「呂」是姓，「犀首」是名。《廣韻．齊韻》：「犀，姓。秦有犀首。」
